Description: Lower part of the back of a child's tunic; Plain weave, undyed linen textile with many self-bands; Tapestry (grouped warp threads) decoration of two roundels in geometric patterns framed by bands (c.6-7cm wide) with two right angles which would be found at the base of a tunic; Geometric and stylised vegetal motifs; Between the decoration is a block of solid colour with two fish-like (dolphins?) motifs in undyed linen; At sides are the remains of seam incorporating a band of bare weft threads and pairs of single purple picks; Warp plain weave: S spun linen, c.26tpc; Weft plain weave: S spun linen, c.14tpc, every 1.5cm are two picks grouped with 3 or 4 threads; Warp tapestry: linen (grouped in 3/10 ribs per cm); Weft tapestry: Z spun purple wool, c.60tpc, yellow/orange wool dots within the decoration, soumak outlining in S spun linen; Edges: one plain selvedge, one rolled and sewn edge, other edges cut and damaged.
Curator's comments: Includes a small bag of threads and soiling from surface clean; Found in old cardboard box in M7; Amateurish weaving of ground around roundels; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (12.5.1992)
